Description: Funerary papyrus of Kerasher containing Book of Breathing made by Isis for her brother Osiris written in hieratic script; frame 2.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: See E.A.W. Budge, Book of the Dead. Facsimiles of the Papyri of Hunefer, Anhai, Kerasher and Netchemet (London 1899), pp.39-43 and pls. I-III. Herbin, F.-R., Books of Breathing and Related Texts (Catalogue of the Books of the Dead and Other Related Texts in the British Museum IV), London, 2008, pp. 38-44, pls. 16-22.
Bibliographic references: Quirke 1993 / Owners of funerary papyri in the British Museum (102)
Herbin 2008 / Books of Breathing and Related Texts (pp.37-45, pls.15-24)

Budge 1899 / The book of the dead: facsimiles of the papyri of Hunefer, Anhai, Kerasher and Netchemet with supplementary text from the papyrus of Nu with transcripts, translations, etc. (pp.39-43, pls.I-III)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (50324) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/50324)
